record.title: PERMANENT SUBCOMMITTEE ON INVESTIGATIONS RULES OF PROCEDURE

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, Senate standing rule XXVI requires each committee to adopt rules to govern the procedure of the committee and to publish those rules in the CONGRESSIONAL RECORD not later than March 1 of the first year of each Congress. On February 16, 2007, a majority of the members of the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs' Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations adopted subcommittee rules of procedure.
Consistent with standing rule XXVI, I ask unanimous consent to have printed in the Congressional Record a copy of the rules of the Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations.
